question: She isn't coming yet, Toto. Did she hurt you? She tried to, didn't she? Come on - - we'll go tell Uncle Henry and Auntie Em. Come on, Toto. Aunt Em! Aunt Em! Aunt Em!
answer: Fifty-seven, fifty-eight --

question: Just listen to what Miss Gulch did to Toto! She --
answer: Dorothy, please! We're trying to count! Fifty-eight--

question: Oh -- oh, the poor little things. Oh, but Aunt Em, Miss Gulch hit Toto right over the back with a rake just because she says he gets in her garden and chases her nasty old cat every day.
answer: Seventy -- Dorothy, please!

question: Oh, but he doesn't do it every day -- just once or twice a week. And he can't catch her old cat, anyway. And now she says she's gonna get the sheriff, and --
answer: Dorothy! Dorothy! We're busy!

question: Poor little orphan, and her Miss Gulch troubles. Gosh all hemlock - you know, she ought to have somebody to play with.
answer: I know, but we all got to work out our own problems, Henry.

question: Yes.
answer: Oh, I hope we got them in time.

question: Now lookit, Dorothy, you ain't using your head about Miss Gulch. Think you didn't have any brains at all.
answer: I have so got brains.

question: Well, why don't you use them? When you come home, don't go by Miss Gulch's place. Then Toto won't get in her garden, and you won't get in no trouble. See?
answer: Oh, Hunk, you just won't listen, that's all.

question: Oh! Oh, it feels like my joints are rusted. Listen, Dorothy, don't let Hunk kid you about Miss Gulch. She's just a poor sour-faced old maid that -- she ain't got no heart left. You know, you should have a little more heart yourself, and have pity on her.
answer: Well, gee, I try and have a heart.

question: Now look, here's something that really has a heart. This is the best invention I ever invented.
answer: This?

question: Sure. It's to break up winds, so we don't have no more dust storms. Can you imagine what it'll mean to this section of the country? I'll show you. It works perfectly now. Here's the principle. You see that fan -- that sends up air currents into the sky. These air currents -- Oh, stop it!
answer: Oh!

question: Who did it? Now wait a minute.
answer: Hickory!

question: Look at you, Zeke -- you're just as white
answer: Here, here, what's all this jabber- wapping when there's work to be done? I know three shiftless farm hands that'll be out of a job before they know it!

question: Well, Dorothy was walking along the --
answer: I saw you tinkering with that contraption, Hickory. Now, you and Hunk get back to that wagon!

question: All right, Mrs. Gale. But some day they're going to erect a statue to me in this town, and --
answer: Well, don't start posing for it now. Here, here -- can't work on an empty stomach. Have some crullers.

question: Auntie Em, really -- you know what Miss Gulch said she was gonna do to Toto? She said she was gonna --
answer: Now, Dorothy, dear, stop imagining things. You always get yourself into a fret over nothing.

question: No --
answer: Now, you just help us out today, and find yourself a place where you won't get into any trouble.

question: Mr. Gale!
answer: Howdy, Miss Gulch.

question: I want to see you and your wife right away.... ... about Dorothy.
answer: Dorothy? Well, what has Dorothy done?

question: What's she done? I'm all but lame from the bite on my leg!
answer: You mean she bit you?

question: No, her dog!
answer: Oh, she bit her dog, eh?

question: Toto, darling! Oh, I got you back! You came back! Oh, I'm so glad! Toto! Oh, they'll be coming back for you in a minute. We've got to get away! We've got to run away -- quick!
answer: Well, well, well -- house guests, huh? And who might you be? No, no -- now don't tell me. Let's see -- you're -- you're travelling in disguise. No, that's not right. I -- you're -- you're going on a visit. No, I'm wrong. That's...You're -- running away.

question: How did you guess?
answer: Professor Marvel never guesses -- he knows! Now, why are you running away?

question: Why --
answer: No, no -- now don't tell me. They -- they don't understand you at home. They don't appreciate you. You want to see other lands -- big cities -- big mountains -- big oceans --

question: Why, it's just like you could read what was inside of me.
answer: Yes --

question: Please, Professor, why can't we go along with you? ...polite! We haven't been asked yet.
answer: He's perfectly welcome. As one dog to another, huh? Here now -- let's see where were we? Oh, yes - you - you wanted to go home, huh?

question: Oh, no, I wanted to go along with you.
answer: Oh --

question: Nobody cares about me at home. They wouldn't even miss me.
answer: Aw, come, come, come --

question: No, they won't - honestly.
answer: Oh --

question: Auntie Em was even going to let them kill Toto yesterday for biting Miss Gulch. Oh, please, Professor, why can't we go with you and see all the Crowned Heads of Europe?
answer: Do you know any? Oh, you mean the thing - - Yes, well, I -- I never do anything without consulting my crystal first. Let's.... ...go inside here -- we'll -- Just come along. I'll show you. There you are - right in there. That's right. Here -- sit right down here. That's it. Ha ha! This -- this is the same genuine, magic, authentic crystal used by the Priests of Isis and Osiris in the days of the Pharaohs of Egypt -- in which Cleopatra first saw the approach of Julius Caesar and Marc Anthony, and -- and so on -- and so on. Now, you -- you'd better close your eyes, my child, for a moment -- in order to be better in tune with the infinite. We -- we can't do these things without.... ...infinite. Yes. That's -- that's all right. Now you can open them. We'll gaze into the crystal. Ahh -- what's this I see? A house -- with a picket fence.... ...and a barn -- with a weather vane and a -- of a -- of a running horse. No - it's - it's - a crowing rooster.

question: That's our farm!
answer: Oh -- yes. Yes, there's -- there's a woman -- she's.... INSERT -- CU of the photograph - ...she's wearing a polka-dot dress.... ...her face is careworn.

question: Yes...That's Aunt Em.
answer: Her -- her name is Emily.

question: That's right. What's she doing?
answer: Well, I -- I can't quite see. Why, she's crying.

question: Oh --
answer: Someone has hurt her -- someone has just about broken her heart.

question: Me?
answer: Well, it's -- it's someone she loves very much. Someone she's been very kind to. Someone she's taken care of in sickness.

question: I had the measles once -- and she stayed right by me every minute.
answer: Uh-huh.

question: What's she doing now?
answer: Well, she's - she's going into a little bed.... CU - Dorothy - Camera shooting past Professor - ...room --

question: Has it poppies on the wall.... MCU - Professor - Camera shooting past Dorothy ...paper?
answer: I said it had poppies on the wall paper! Eh -- she's -- What's this? Why, she's -- she's putting her hand on her heart -- she's -- she's dropping down on the.... ...bed.

question: Oh, no -- no!
answer: That's all -- the Crystal's gone dark.

question: Oh, you.... ...you don't suppose she could really be sick, do you? Oh -- Oh, I've got to go home right away!
answer: But -- what's this? I thought you were going along with me.

question: Oh, no, no, I have to get to her right.... ...away! Come on, Toto! Oh, what'll I do? If we go home, they'll send you to the Sheriff. And if we don't, Aunt Em may -- well, she may die! I know what I'll do - I'll give you to Hunk. He'll watch out for you. But we've got to hurry. Goodbye, Professor Marvel -- and thanks a lot!
answer: Better get under cover, Sylvester -- there's a storm blowing up -- a whopper, to speak in the vernacular of the peasantry. Poor little kid -- I hope she gets home all right.

question: Hunk, get them horses loose! Where's Hickory. Hickory! Hickory! Doggone it! Hick -- Hey, what are you doing there?
answer: This is my chance! The cyclone is coming. Let me show you what my machine can do! You see, it goes --

question: Doggone you! Help Hunk get them horses loose!
answer: All right - you'll be sorry.

question: Auntie Em! Auntie Em! We're not on the ground, Toto! We must be up inside.... MCS -- Toto looks out from under bed -- DOROTHY o.s. Toto -- I've a feeling we're not in Kansas anymore. We must be over the rainbow! Now I -- I know we're not in Kansas.
answer: Are you a good witch, or a bad witch?

question: Who, me? Why, I'm not a witch at all. I'm Dorothy Gale from Kansas.
answer: Oh! Well....

question: Who, Toto? Toto's my dog.
answer: Well, I'm a little muddled. The Munchkins called me because a new witch has just dropped a house on the Wicked Witch of the East. And there's the house, and here you are, and that's all... ...is, are you a good witch, or a bad witch?

question: Oh, but I've already told you, I'm not a witch at all -- witches are old and ugly. What was that?
answer: The Munchkins. They're laughing because I am a witch. I'm Glinda, the Witch of the North.

question: You are! Oh, I beg your pardon! But I've never heard of a beautiful.... MCU -- Glinda looks to r.f.g. and speaks -- DOROTHY o.s.
answer: Only bad witches are ugly. The Munchkins are happy because you have freed them from the Wicked Witch of the East.

question: Oh. But, if you please -- what are Munchkins?
answer: The little people who live in this land -- it's Munchkinland, and you are their national heroine, my dear. It's all right -- you may all come out and thank her. It's all right now - you may all come out. Come out, come out, wherever you are And meet the young lady who fell from a star. She fell from the sky, she fell very far. And Kansas she says is the name of the star.

question: As Mayor of the Munchkin City In the County of the Land of Oz I welcome you most regally
answer: But we've got to verify it legally To see...

question: To see?
answer: If she...

question: If she?
answer: Is morally, ethic'ly

question: Then this is a day of Independence For all the Munchkins and their descendants!
answer: If any!

question: I'm the only one that knows how to use them. They're of no use to you! Give them back to me!
answer: Keep tight inside of them -- their magic must be very powerful, or she wouldn't want them so badly!

question: You stay out of this, Glinda, or I'll fix you as well!
answer: Oh, rubbish! You have no power here. Be gone, before somebody drops a house on you, too.

question: Very well -- I'll bide my time -- and as for you, my fine lady, it's true, I can't attend to you here and now as I'd like, but just try to stay out of my way.... MCU -- Witch threatens Dorothy o.s. in f.g. -- ... -- just try! I'll get you, my....
answer: It's all right. You can get up -- she's gone. It's all right. You can all get up. Pooh -- what a smell of sulphur! I'm afraid you've made rather a bad enemy of the Wicked Witch of the West. The sooner you get out of Oz altogether, the safer you'll sleep, my dear.

question: It's all right. You can get up -- she's gone. It's all right. You can all get up. Pooh -- what a smell of sulphur! I'm afraid you've made rather a bad enemy of the Wicked Witch of the West. The sooner you get out of Oz altogether, the safer you'll sleep, my dear.
answer: Oh, I'd give anything to get out of Oz altogether -- but which is the way back to Kansas? I can't go the way I came.

question: No -- that's true. The only person who might know would be the great and wonderful Wizard of Oz himself!
answer: The Wizard of Oz? Is he good or is he wicked?

question: Oh, very good, but very mysterious. He lives in the Emerald City, and that's a long journey from here. Did you bring your broomstick with you?
answer: No, I'm afraid I didn't.

question: Well, then, you'll have to walk. The Munchkins will see you safely to the border of Munchkinland. And remember, never let those ruby slippers off your feet for a moment, or you will be at the mercy of the Wicked Witch of the West.
answer: But, how do I start for Emerald City?

question: It's always best to start at the beginning -- and all you do is follow the Yellow Brick Road.
answer: But -- what happens if I --- CS -- Glinda speaks to Dorothy o.s. in f.g. --

question: Just follow the Yellow Brick Road.
answer: My -- ! People come and go so quickly here! Follow the Yellow Brick Road. Follow the Yellow Brick Road?

question: Follow the Yellow Brick Road? Follow the Yellow....? Now which way do we go?
answer: That way is a very nice way. CS -- Scarecrow, his arm pointing to right --

question: Who said that? Don't be silly, Toto. Scarecrows.... ...don't talk.
answer: It's pleasant down that way, too.

question: That's funny. Wasn't he pointing the other way?
answer: ...go both ways!

question: Why.... ...you did say something, didn't you? CS- The Scarecrow shakes his head, then nods - Are you doing that on purpose, or can't you make up your mind?
answer: That's the trouble. I can't make up my mind. I haven't got a brain -- only straw.

question: How can you talk if you haven't got a.... MCU -- Scarecrow speaks to Dorothy o.s.in f.g. -- DOROTHY o.s.
answer: I don't know. But some people without brains do an awful lot of talking, don't they?

question: Yes, I guess you're right. Well, we haven't really met properly, have we?
answer: Why, no.

question: How do you do?
answer: How do you do?

question: Very well, thank you.
answer: Oh, I'm not feeling at all well. You see, it's very tedious being stuck up here all day long with a pole up your back. MCU -- Dorothy --

question: Oh, dear -- that must be terribly uncomfortable. Can't you get down?
answer: Down? No, you see, I'm -- Well, -- I'm --

question: Oh, well, here -- let me help you.
answer: Oh, that's very kind of you -- very kind.

question: Well, oh, dear -- I don't quite see....
answer: Of course, I'm not bright about doing things, but if you'll just....

question: Oh.... ...yes.
answer: Ohhhh --

question: Ohh!
answer: Whhhooops! Ha-ha -- there goes some of me again!

question: Oh -- does it hurt you?
answer: Oh, no -- I just keep picking it up and putting it back in again.

question: Ohhh --
answer: My, it's good to be.... ...free!

question: Oh! Oh! Ohhh!
answer: Did I scare you?

question: No, No -- I -- I just thought you hurt yourself.
answer: But I didn't scare you?

question: No -- of course not.
answer: I didn't think so. Boo! You see, I can't even scare a crow! They come from miles.... MCU -- Dorothy listening -- SCARECROW o.s. Oh, I'm a failure, because I haven't got a brain.

question: Well, what would you do with a brain if you had one?
answer: Do? Why, if I had a brain, I could -- I could while away the hours, Conferrin' with the flowers, Consultin' with the rain. And my head I'd be scratchin' While my thoughts were busy hatchin' If I only had a brain. I'd unravel every riddle For any individ'le

question: With the thoughts you'll be thinkin' You could be another Lincoln If you only had a brain.
answer: Oh, I could tell you why The ocean's near the shore I could think of things I never thunk before, ...Life would be a ding-a-derry If I only had a brain! Gosh, it would be awful pleasin' To reason out the reason For things I can't explain. Then perhaps I'll deserve you, And be even worthy erv you If I only had a brain.

question: Wonderful! Why, if our Scarecrow back in Kansas could do that, the crows'd be scared to pieces!
answer: They would?

question: Um-hmm.
answer: Where's Kansas?

question: That's where I live. And I want to get back there so badly I'm going all the way to Emerald City to get the Wizard of Oz to help me.
answer: You're going to see a Wizard?

question: Um-hmm.
answer: Do you think if I went with you this Wizard would give me some brains?

question: I couldn't say. But even if he didn't, you'd be no worse off than you are now.
answer: Yes -- that's true.

question: But maybe you'd better not. I've got a witch mad at me, and you might get into trouble.
answer: Witch? Huh! I'm not afraid of a witch! I'm not afraid of anything --- except a lighted match.

question: I don't blame you for that.
answer: But I'd face a whole box full of them for the chance of getting some brains. Look - - I won't be any trouble, because I don't eat a thing -- and I won't try to manage things, because I can't think. Won't you take me with you?

question: Why, of course I will!
answer: Hooray! We're off to see a Wizard!

question: Oh -- well -- you're not starting out very well.
answer: Oh, I'll try! Really, I will.

question: To Oz?
answer: To Oz!

question: Come along, Dorothy -- you don't want any of those apples. Hmm! MCU -- First tree reacts, and speaks -- Oh, no! It's just that she doesn't like little green....
Go -- Go!
answer: ...Oh -- Help -- let me out. I'll give you little green....

question: I'll show you how to get apples. TREE o.s.
answer: ...do that to me! I'll....

question: Yes --- there.
answer: Mm.....mm...mm.... ...m...m...my, my, my, my goodness -- I can talk again! Oh -- oil my arms, please -- oil my elbows.

question: Oh...
answer: Oh --

question: ...Oh, did that hurt?
answer: No -- it feels wonderful. I've held that axe up for ages. Oh ---

question: Oh, goodness! How did you ever get like this?
answer: Oh -- well, about a year ago -- I was chopping that tree -- minding my own business -- when suddenly it started to rain.... ...and right in the middle of a chop, I...I rusted solid. And I've been that way ever since.

question: Well, you're perfect now.
answer: My...my neck. My...my neck. Perfect? Oh -- bang on my chest if you think I'm perfect. Go ahead -- bang on it!

question: It's empty. The tinsmith forgot to give me a heart. No heart.
answer: Oh --

question: All hollow. Oh -- When a man's an empty kettle, He should be on his mettle. And yet I'm torn apart. Just because I'm presumin' That I could be kind-a human, If I only had a heart. I'd be tender -- I'd be gentle And awful sentimental Regarding Love and Art I'd be friends with sparrows... ...And the boy who shoots the arrows If I only had a heart. Picture me....a balcony....Above a voice sings low. I hear a beat....how sweet! Just to register emotion Jealousy -- Devotion -- And really feel the part, I could stay young and chipper, And I'd lock it with a zipper, If I only had a heart...!
answer: Oh -- Oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, are you all right?

question: I'm afraid I'm a little rusty yet.
answer: Oh, dear -- That was wonderful! You know -- we were just wondering why you couldn't come to Emerald City with us to ask the Wizard of Oz for a heart.

question: I'll see you reach the Wizard, whether I get a heart of not. Bee-hive -- bah! Let her try and make a bee-hive out of me! You know -- Hmm? What's that? Oh! They're - they're gone now.
answer: Oh, goodness! Did any of them sting you?

question: I - I guess they tried to, but they bent their stingers.
answer: Oh, dear. I don't know what I'd do if a whole swarm kept -- Oh! Oh! Oh, there's one on me!

question: Oh - I'll get it!
answer: Oh! Oh! Oh --

question: Oh, see - I killed it. Oh, I killed that poor little honey bee!
answer: Oh-oh-

question: It's only a man without a head who could do a thing like that. Poor little bee. CU - Dorothy reacts - reaches o.s. -
answer: Oh, there.... ...there. Don't cry. There. CU - Dorothy looks o.s. - speaks - As a matter of fact, that's just an old drone bee, and it would have died.... CU - Tin Man looks o.s. - DOROTHY o.s.

question: Yes? Oh.
answer: ...just that the Witch is so wicked. I don't think you two ought to come with me because you'll get into trouble.

question: And bears.
answer: Oh! Lions and tigers and bears! Oh, my! Oh, my! Oh, my! Oh, my! Oh, my!

question: And bears!
answer: What sort of an animal is that?

question: Well, I'll get you, anyway, Pee-Wee. CU -- Dorothy reacts -- exits left f.g. --
answer: Shame on you!

question: What -- what did you do that for? I didn't bite him.
answer: No, but you tried to. It's bad enough picking on a straw man, but when you go around picking on poor little dogs --

question: Well, you didn't have to go and hit me, did you? Is my nose bleeding?
answer: Well, of course not. My goodness, what a fuss you're making. Well, naturally, when you go around picking on things weaker than you are -- Why, you're nothing but a great big coward!

question: I'm sure he could give you some courage. MCU -- Lion -- Camera shooting past Dorothy --
answer: Well, wouldn't you feel degraded to be seen in the company of a cowardly lion? I would.

question: No, of course not.
answer: Gee, that's -- that's awfully nice of you. My life.... ...has been simply unbearable.

question: Oh.
answer: Yeh, it's sad, believe me, Missy When you're born to be a sissy, Without the vim and verve. But I could show my prowess -- Be a lion not a mou-ess -- If I only had the nerve I'm afraid there's no denyin' I'm just a dande-lion -- A fate I don't deserve. I'd be brave as a blizzard --

question: Come on -- come on --
answer: Hurry -- hurry --

question: Oh! Oh, come on, come on!
answer: Look -- you can see it here. It's wonderful!

question: Emerald City!
answer: Oh -- Oh -- what's happening? What is it? I can't run anymore. I'm so.... CS -- Tin Man and Scarecrow -- DOROTHY o.s.

question: Here -- give us your hands, and we'll pull you.... ...along.
answer: Oh, no -- please. I have to rest for just a minute. Toto!

question: Don't you start it, too!
answer: Oh! We ought to try and carry Dorothy.

question: I don't think I could, but we could try.
answer: Let's.

question: Yes.
answer: Oh -- now look at him! This is terrible!

question: Here, Tin Man -- help me. CS -- Dorothy as Scarecrow tries to lift her -- Oh, this is terrible -- can't budge her an inch! This is a spell, this is!
answer: It's the Wicked Witch! What'll we do? Help! HELP!

question: Look! He's rusted again. Oh, give me the oil can -- quick! Oh-oh, quick!
answer: Yes -- there --

question: Oh -- here quick -- oh! - we'll oil him up.
answer: -- A hot water bottle would be good if we had one.

question: The notice! It's on the door -- as plain as the nose on my face! It -- Oh -- CU -- Doorman reacts -- starts out -- Well, that's more like it. Now, state your business! Ooooh! The Wizard? But nobody can see the Great Oz! Nobody's ever seen the Great Oz! Even I've never seen him!
answer: Well, then -- how do you know there is one? CU -- Doorman speaks -- reacts -- starts out --

question: Because he -- I -- Oh, you're wasting my time!
answer: ...sir. I've got to see the Wizard! The Good Witch of the North sent me! CU -- Doorman looks o.s. -- speaks --

question: Cabby! Cabby! Just what you're looking for! Take you any place in the City, we does.
answer: Well, would you take us to see the Wizard?

question: The Wizard? The Wizard? I -- can't -- Well -- Yes, of course. But first I'll take you to a little place where you can....
answer: Oh, thank you so much. We've been gone such a long time, and we feel so mess -- What kind of a horse is that? I've never seen a horse like that before!

question: No -- and never will again, I fancy. There's only one of him, and he's it. He's the Horse of a Different Color, you've heard tell about. Ha -- ha -- ha -- ...das -- ...And start to work at one Take an hour for lunch.... ...And then at two we're done Jolly good fun!
answer: Can you even dye my eyes to match my gown? Jolly old town!

question: Here -- here -- here -- wait a minute! Wait a minute! Stop - stop - stop! It's all right! Every -- It's all right! Everything is all right! The Great and Powerful Oz has got matters well in hand - I hope -- So you can all go.... ...home -- and there's nothing to worry about.
answer: If you please, sir. We want to see the Wizard right away -- all four of us.

question: Orders are -- nobody can see the Great Oz! Not nobody -- not nohow!
answer: Oh, but we must!

question: Orders are - not nobody! Not nohow! He's in conference with himself on account of this.... ...trouble with the Witch. And even if he wasn't you wouldn't have been able to see him anyway on account of nobody has - not even us in the Palace!
answer: Oh, but -- but please. It's very important.

question: Imposserous!
answer: How about a hippopotamus?

question: Why, I'd thrash him from top to bottomamus!
answer: Supposin' you met an elephant?

question: I'd show him who was King of the Fores'!
answer: How?

question: How? Courage! What makes the flag on the mast to wave? Courage! ...mist, or the dusky dusk? What makes the muskrat guard his musk? Courage! What makes the sphinx the seventh wonder? Courage!
answer: Courage!

question: Don't you know the Wizard's going to give you some courage?
answer: I'd be too scared to ask him for it.

question: Oh, well, then -- we'll ask him for you.
answer: I'd sooner wait outside.

question: But why? Why?
answer: Because I'm still scared!

question: Oh, come on.
answer: Ohh!

question: Ohh!
answer: What happened?

question: Somebody pulled my tail.
answer: Oh, you did it yourself!

question: I -- Oh --
answer: Here -- Come on.

question: I am Oz, the Great and Powerful! Who are you? Who are you?
answer: I -- If you please, I - I am Dorothy, ...the small and meek. We've come to ask you --

question: Silence!
answer: Ohhh -- Jiminy Crickets! ELS -- Throne --

question: The Great and Powerful Oz knows why you have come. Step forward,.... ...Tin Man!
answer: Ohhhh -- it's me!

question: You dare to come to me for a heart, do you? You clinking, clanking, clattering collection of caliginous.... ...junk!
answer: Ohhhh -- yes...yes, sir -- Y-Yes, your Honor. You see, a while back, we were walking down the Yellow Brick Road, and --

question: Quiet!
answer: Ohhhhhh!

question: Oh, poor Dorothy. We may never see her again.
answer: Who do you suppose they were? And where did they take her? A fine thing - to go to pieces at a time like this!

question: Now, now, don't fret.
answer: Oh, dear, dear.

question: What a nice little dog! And you, my dear. What an unexpected pleasure! It's so kind of you to visit me in my loneliness.
answer: What are you going to do with my dog? Give him back to me!

question: All in good time, my little pretty -- all in good time.
answer: Oh, please give me back my dog!

question: Certainly -- certainly -- when you give me those slippers.
answer: But the Good Witch of the North told me not to.

question: Very well! Throw that basket in the river and drown him!
answer: No! No -- no! Here -- you can have your old slippers -- but give me back Toto.

question: That's a good little girl. I knew you'd see reason. Ahh! Ah!
answer: I'm sorry. I didn't do it! Can I still have my dog?

question: No! Fool, that I am! I should have remembered -- those slippers will never come off, as long as... CU -- Dorothy reacts -- speaks -- WITCH o.s.
answer: What are you gonna do? CU - Witch looks up o.s. - speaks -

question: What do you think I'm going to do? But that's not what's worrying me -- it's how to do it. These things must be done delicately....
answer: Run, Toto, run!

question: Catch him, you fool!
answer: He got away! He got away!

question: Oh, don't worry about me. I'm all right. We must worry about Dorothy.
answer: But how can we find her? We don't even know where she is. Look! There's....

question: Why, don't you see? He's come to take us.... ...to Dorothy!
answer: Oh --

question: Don't cry now. We haven't got the oil- can with us and you've been squeaking enough as it is.

question: I've got a plan how to get in there.
answer: Fine. He's got a plan

question: And you're going to lead us.
answer: Yeah. Me?

question: Yes, you.
answer: I -- I -- I -- I -- gotta get her outta there?

question: That's right.
answer: All right, I'll go in there for Dorothy -- Wicked Witch or no Wicked Witch -- guards or no guards -- I'll tear 'em apart. I may not come out alive, but I'm going in there. There's only one thing I want you fellows to do. Talk me out of it.

question: She's....she's....dead! You've killed her!
answer: I -- I didn't mean to kill her....really I didn't! It's...it's just that he was on fire!

question: Hail to Dorothy! The Wicked Witch is dead!
answer: You mean, you're...you're all happy about it?

question: Very happy - now she won't be able to hit us with a broom....
answer: The broom! May we have it?

question: Please! And take it with you!
answer: Oh -- thank you so much! Now we can go back to the Wizard and tell him the Wicked Witch is dead!

question: Can I believe my eyes? Why.... ...have you come back?
answer: Please, sir. We've done what you told us. We've brought you the broomstick of the Wicked Witch of the West. We melted her.

question: Oh .... ...you liquidated her, eh? Very.... ...resourceful!
answer: Yes, sir. So we'd like you to keep your promise to us, if you please, sir.

question: Not so fast! Not.... MLS -- Throne -- ...so fast! I'll have to give the matter a little thought. Go away and come back tomorrow!
answer: Tomorrow? Oh, but I want to go home now.

question: Do not arouse the wrath.... ...of the Great and Powerful Oz! I said - - come back tomorrow!
answer: If you were really great and powerful, you'd keep your promises!

question: Do you presume to criticize the.... ...Great Oz? You ungrateful creatures! Think yourselves lucky that I'm.... ...giving you audience tomorrow, instead of.... ...twenty years from now. Oh -- oh oh! The Great Oz has spoken! Oh -- Oh --- ... Oh .... Oh ....
answer: Who are you?

question: Oh - I - Pay no.... ...attention to that man behind the curtain. Go - before I lose my temper! The Great and Powerful ---.... ... -- Oz -- has spoken!
answer: Who are you?

question: Well, I -- I -- I am the Great and Powerful -- Wizard of Oz.
answer: You are?

question: Oh, no, my dear -- I'm -- I'm a very good man. I'm just a very bad Wizard.
answer: You'd better be good enough to send Dorothy back to Kansas!

question: Uh - now, please don't be angry with me. I'll - I'll do anything you say, only... only if you don't shout at me. It makes me nervous!
answer: It makes you nervous?

question: Yes.
answer: What about us?

question: Well, I --
answer: What about the heart that you promised Tin Man --?

question: Well, I --
answer: -- And the courage that you promised Cowardly Lion?

question: You do? boys, you're aiming low. You not only surprise, but you grieve me. Why, anybody can have a brain. That's a very mediocre commodity. Every pusillanimous creature that crawls on the earth -- or slinks through slimy seas has a brain! From the rock-bound coast of Maine to the Sun.... oh - oh, no -- -- ah - Well, be that as it may. Back where I come from we have universities, seats of great learning -- where men go to become great thinkers. And when they come out, they think deep thoughts -- and with no more brains than you have.... But! They have one thing you haven't got! A diploma! Therefore, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Universitatus Committeeatum e plurbis unum, I hereby confer upon you the honorary degree of Th.D.
answer: Th.D.?

question: Yeah -- that...that's Dr. of Thinkology!
answer: The sum of the square roots of any two sides of an isosceles triangle is equal to the square root of the remaining side. Oh joy, rapture! I've got a brain! How can I ever thank you enough?

question: Yes. Dorothy -- ah -- Dor -- CU -- Dorothy --
answer: Oh, I don't think there's anything in that black bag for me.

question: Well, no - no -- on the contrary, on the - ...I -- ah -- on the contr -- -- Here -- Well, you force me into a cataclysmic decision. The only way to get Dorothy back to Kansas is for me to take her there myself! CU -- Dorothy reacts, speaks --
answer: Oh, will you? Could you? Oh -- but are you a clever enough Wizard.... MCU -- The Wizard -- DOROTHY o.s.

question: Yes. There was I, floating through space - - a man without a continent! CU -- Dorothy --
answer: Weren't you frightened?

question: Frightened? You are talking to a man who has laughed in the face of death -- sneered at doom and chuckled at catastrophe. I was petrified. Then suddenly the wind changed, and the balloon floated down into the heart of this noble city, where I was instantly acclaimed Oz, the First Wizard de Luxe!
answer: Ohhh!

question: Times being what they were, I accepted the job, -- retaining my balloon against the advent of a quick get-away. And in that balloon, my dear Dorothy, you and I will return to the land of E Pluribus Unum! Good people of Oz, this is positively the finest exhibition ever to be shown -- -- yes -- well -- be that as it may -- I, your Wizard par ardua ad alta, am about to embark upon a hazardous and technically unexplainable journey into the outer stratosphere. To confer, converse, and otherwise hob- nob with my brother wizards. And I hereby decree that until what time -- if any -- that I return, the Scarecrow, by virtue of his highly superior brains, shall rule in my stead...assisted by the Tin Man, by virtue of his magnificent heart...and the Lion -- by virtue of his courage! Obey them as you would me! And - ah - well, that's all.
answer: Oh, come back here! Toto! Come back! Oh, don't go without me! I'll be right back! Toto!

question: Stop that dog!
answer: This is a highly irregular procedure! This is absolutely unprecedented!

question: Oh! Help me! The balloon's going up!
answer: -- Ruined my exit!

question: Oh! Come back! Don't go without me! Please come back!
answer: I can't come back! I don't know how it works!

question: Oh --
answer: Goodbye, folks!

question: No. She had to find it out for herself. Now, those magic slippers will take you home in two seconds!
answer: Oh.... ...Toto, too?

question: Toto, too.
answer: Oh, now?

question: Whenever you wish.
answer: Oh, dear -- that's too wonderful to be true! Oh, it's -- it's going to be so hard to say goodbye. I love you all, too. Goodbye, Tin Man. Oh, don't cry. You'll rust so dreadfully. Here -- here's your oil-can. Goodbye.

question: I think I'll miss you most of all.
answer: Are you ready now?

question: Yes. Say goodbye, Toto. Yes, I'm ready now.
answer: Then close your eyes, and tap your heels together three times. And think to yourself -- "There's no place like home; there's no place like home; there's no place like home."
